title: 114_s3264
content: SPECIAL RULE FOR FACILITIES GENERATING ELECTRICITY FROM BIOMASS AND MUNICIPAL SOLID WASTE. Special rule for certain qualified facilities under Section 45(e) of the Internal Revenue Code allows taxpayers to elect to apply subsection (a)(2)(A)(ii) for electricity produced at qualified facilities placed in service before a specified date. The amendment allows taxpayers to elect a credit for electricity produced and sold at a facility for over 10 years. Effective January 1, 2017. Modification to the definition of municipal solid waste. The definition of municipal solid waste is modified to exclude commonly recycled paper and solid waste collected in a system that mixes recycled paper with non-recycled waste. The definition of municipal solid waste is modified to exclude commonly recycled paper and solid waste collected in a system that mixes recycled paper with non-recycled waste. This exclusion does not apply to solid waste with only a small amount of recycled paper or residual waste from a materials recovery facility processing mainly recyclable materials. The definition of municipal solid waste is modified to exclude commonly recycled paper and waste collected in a system mixing recycled paper with non-recycled waste. This exclusion does not require changes to waste collection systems or regulations implementing the Solid Waste Disposal Act. In relation to electricity produced from solid waste, rules are amended to specify the source of municipal solid waste feedstock for qualified facilities. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment of this Act for qualified facilities producing electricity from municipal solid waste and other solid waste that is not a qualified energy resource.
